summary: This document outlines the procedures and responsibilities of a committee within Deutsche Bank, including decision-making processes, quorum requirements, and the role of the Secretary. It emphasizes the importance of documentation and the Chairman's veto rights, while noting that certain veto powers are not applicable under US corporate law.
keyFacts: The document describes the role and responsibilities of the Secretary of the Committee.
Decisions require a quorum of the Chairman and at least 50% of Voting Members.
Decisions can be made through various means, including electronically or by telephone.
The Chairman has veto rights over decisions until meeting minutes are finalized.
The document notes that the veto right is not applicable under US corporate law.
